channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 威尔士王妃凯瑟琳说，她的癌症是在腹部手术后发现的，她正在接受 "预防性化疗"。以下是我们了解到的情况。
item.description:
Catherine, Princess of Wales, said that her cancer had been discovered after abdominal surgery and that she was receiving “preventative chemotherapy.” Here’s what we know. https://t.co/Rj3MLysuox

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 据国家通讯社报道，俄罗斯最高安全机构称，枪手周五袭击了莫斯科的一个音乐会场馆，造成至少40人死亡，100多人受伤。图片显示了可能是俄罗斯数十年来最致命袭击的现场。
item.description:
Gunmen stormed a Moscow concert venue on Friday, killing at least 40 people and wounding more than 100, Russia’s top security agency said, according to state news agencies. Images show the scene of what could be the deadliest attack in Russia in decades. https://t.co/MZSHIx1jq9

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 随着大选的临近，印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪与反对党控制的各邦之间的政治纷争正在给维系印度的联邦模式带来压力。
item.description:
As an election nears, political strife between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and opposition-held states is straining the federal formula that holds India together. https://t.co/MKRa1RZCH3

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 23, 2024

item.title: 罗伯特-L.-巴里（Robert L. Barry）是美国武器协议的首席谈判代表，美国官员认为该协议对冷战即将结束时缓和东西方紧张局势非常重要。他已去世，享年 89 岁。
item.description:
Robert L. Barry was the chief U.S. negotiator for an arms accord that American officials considered important in reducing East-West tensions near the end of the Cold War. He has died at 89. https://t.co/qDXazsdivk

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 在过去两年里，"The Rest is Politics "的政治履历和节目的中间派倾向使其成为英国最受欢迎的播客之一。
item.description:
Over the last two years, the political résumés and the show’s centrist leanings have made “The Rest is Politics” one of the most popular podcasts in Britain. https://t.co/JFDh61CSaK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 以色列制琴师阿姆农-温斯坦（Amnon Weinstein）去世，享年 84 岁。他修复了大屠杀期间属于犹太人的小提琴，使世界各地的音乐家能够演奏这些小提琴，以充满希望的旋律向那些在纳粹死亡集中营中沉默的人们致敬。
item.description:
Amnon Weinstein, an Israeli luthier who restored violins belonging to Jews during the Holocaust so musicians around the world could play them in hopeful, melodic tributes to those silenced in Nazi death camps, has died at 84. https://t.co/JPE8ikNZGT

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：据俄罗斯国家通讯社报道，枪手在莫斯科郊外一个受欢迎的音乐会场开火。
item.description:
Breaking News: Gunmen opened fire at a popular concert venue outside Moscow, Russian state news agencies reported. https://t.co/bPt9c01zUP

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 由美国起草的安全理事会决议包含了华盛顿迄今为止支持的最强烈措辞，这显然是以色列最亲密盟友的一次逆转
item.description:
The Security Council resolution drafted by the United States contains the strongest language that Washington has supported so far, and was an apparent reversal for Israel’s closest ally https://t.co/nIyPsrLrVN

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 在总理意外辞职后，爱尔兰政坛接下来会发生什么？
item.description:
Here’s what’s next in Irish politics after the prime minister’s unexpected resignation https://t.co/RXMbPB4SEw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 瑞典法院一直在辩论对一块坠落在斯德哥尔摩北部的陨石的索赔问题，包括在大自然中（包括在私有财产上）活动的权利是否延伸到对陨石的索赔。
item.description:
Sweden’s courts have been debating claims to a meteorite that fell north of Stockholm, including whether the right to move around in nature, including on private property, extends to claiming a meteorite. https://t.co/bnl05f8lFr

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 佛罗里达州的一对夫妇前往多米尼加共和国参加婚礼，他们把两岁的儿子寄放在邻国海地的亲戚家，结果孩子却被该国日益严重的动乱困住了。
item.description:
A trip by a Florida couple to the Dominican Republic to attend a wedding turned into days of anxiety after they dropped off their 2-year-old son with relatives in neighboring Haiti and the boy ended up trapped by that country’s worsening upheaval. https://t.co/g7cKRksLhK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 在死亡无处不在的前线，收集俄罗斯士兵尸体的平民面临着战争中的许多危险。
item.description:
Civilians who gather dead Russian soldiers face many of the war’s perils along the front, where death is ubiquitous. https://t.co/z1GLjK2WLL

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: Insooni 的母亲是韩国人，父亲是美国黑人士兵，她在韩国这个长期歧视黑白混血儿的国家一举成名。
item.description:
Born to a South Korean mother and a Black American soldier, Insooni rose to a pioneering stardom in South Korea, a country that has long discriminated against biracial children. https://t.co/HyCkFfXEZS

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 塔利班官员说，他们的初步调查显示，该地区的 "伊斯兰国 "分支机构是这起致命爆炸的幕后黑手。
item.description:
Taliban officials said their initial investigations suggested that the Islamic State affiliate in the region had been behind the deadly blast. https://t.co/8n61LMwdly

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 长期以来，德国一直以自己是劳资关系和谐的欧洲国家而自豪。但今年情况不同了，罢工浪潮袭击了德国雇主。
item.description:
Germany long prided itself on being the European country with placid labor relations. Not this year, as a wave of strikes hits German employers. https://t.co/jwaRowCeB9

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 乌干达总统已在位近四十年，他任命自己的儿子为该国军队首脑，这加剧了人们长期以来的猜疑，即他正在为自己的儿子有朝一日接替自己做准备。
item.description:
Uganda’s president, who has been in office for nearly four decades, has appointed his son as the head of the country’s military, fueling long-held suspicions that he is preparing his son to one day succeed him. https://t.co/cG6MCIy9xm

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 2020 年以来，非洲发生的 9 次成功政变中有 8 次发生在前法国殖民地。非洲的民主出现了问题，尤其是在曾经被法国殖民的国家。为什么会这样？
item.description:
Eight of the 9 successful coups in Africa since 2020 have been in former French colonies. Democracy is in trouble in Africa, but especially in the countries once colonized by France. Why? https://t.co/xU5XDWlOjE

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯导弹和无人机的大规模袭击破坏了发电厂，造成 100 多万乌克兰人停电，乌克兰官员称这是战争中对能源基础设施的最大规模袭击之一。
item.description:
A large-scale Russian missile and drone attack damaged power plants and caused blackouts for more than a million Ukrainians, in what Ukrainian officials said was one of the war’s largest assaults on energy infrastructure. https://t.co/SyyqAE1ae2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 22, 2024

item.title: 周四，阿富汗坎大哈发生一起自杀式爆炸事件，造成至少 20 人死亡，其中包括塔利班成员，医院工作人员说，这起血腥事件提醒人们，自美国领导的战争结束以来，阿富汗仍然存在威胁。
item.description:
A suicide bombing in Kandahar, Afghanistan, on Thursday killed at least 20 people, including Taliban members, hospital staff said, in a bloody reminder of the threats that persist in the country since the U.S.-led war ended. https://t.co/XWrcN54Au2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 在女足世界杯上亲吻一名球员后辞职的西班牙足球官员路易斯-鲁比亚莱斯（Luis Rubiales）面临西班牙调查人员的逮捕，他们正在调查对他的腐败和洗钱指控。
item.description:
Luis Rubiales, the Spanish soccer official who resigned after kissing a player at the Women’s World Cup, faces arrest by Spanish investigators who are looking into accusations of corruption and money laundering. https://t.co/vEAnK69Psg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 墨西哥最强大的犯罪团伙之一 "哈利斯科新生代 "运营着一个呼叫中心，提供购买退休人员度假房产的服务。然后，他们会清空受害者的银行账户。
item.description:
One of Mexico’s most powerful criminal groups, Jalisco New Generation, runs call centers that offer to buy retirees’ vacation properties. Then, they empty their victims’ bank accounts. https://t.co/6X2etIWimP

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 印度最大的反对党指责国家当局在关键的大选前几周因税务纠纷阻止该党使用银行账户，从而使其政治活动陷入瘫痪。
item.description:
India’s largest opposition party accused the national authorities of paralyzing its political activities by blocking the party’s access to its bank accounts in a tax dispute just weeks before a pivotal general election. https://t.co/NIsMatYZoS

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 据当地官员称，俄罗斯导弹周四早些时候突入基辅，对乌克兰首都发动了数周来最大规模的袭击，造成至少 13 人受伤，数栋居民楼和工业设施受损。
item.description:
Russian missiles streaked into Kyiv early Thursday in the biggest assault on the Ukrainian capital in weeks, injuring at least 13 people and damaging several residential buildings and industrial facilities, according to local officials. https://t.co/sXru57mfLc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 切加党将自己视为消除选民不满情绪的解药，这既扰乱了葡萄牙政坛，也给整个欧洲体制注入了新的焦虑。
item.description:
The Chega party has cast itself as the antidote for voter discontent, both unsettling Portuguese politics and injecting new anxiety throughout the European establishment. https://t.co/1y1NImQXjr

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 21, 2024

item.title: 弗兰斯-德瓦尔（Frans de Waal）利用他对动物内心世界的研究，有力地证明了猿类会思考、感受、制定战略、传承文化并根据道德情感行事--人类并不像我们许多人认为的那样特殊--他去世了，享年 75 岁。
item.description:
Frans de Waal, who used his study of the inner lives of animals to build a powerful case that apes think, feel, strategize, pass down culture and act on moral sentiments — and that humans are not as special as many of us like to think — has died at 75. https://t.co/jNHIdBQPDs

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 英国上议院在一次罕见的反抗中，暂时阻止了一项将寻求庇护者送往卢旺达的法律，这是首相苏纳克的移民议程的核心内容。
item.description:
Britain’s House of Lords, in a rare show of defiance, temporarily blocked a law that would send asylum seekers to Rwanda, a centerpiece of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s immigration agenda. https://t.co/74Gb31WwcK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 火山爆发的影响波及半岛以外地区，扰乱了这个严重依赖游客的国家的旅游业务
item.description:
The effects of the volcanic eruptions rippled out beyond the peninsula, disrupting the tourism operations of a country that relies heavily on visitors https://t.co/mm9xKoACsY

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 一位艺术家说，基于性别的歧视是她在澳大利亚创作的女性专属艺术装置的核心，但一位参观者声称这也是非法的。
item.description:
An artist says gender-based discrimination is central to her women-only art installation in Australia, but one visitor claims it is also illegal. https://t.co/GkjpO4LPhN

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 没有树木的林冠漫步。东欧的一个项目突显了维克托-欧尔班的政党如何将欧盟资金输送给其支持者。
item.description:
A forest canopy walk without trees. A project in eastern Europe highlights how Viktor Orban’s party channels E.U. funds to its supporters. https://t.co/cYRpn5emsx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 欧盟计划利用冻结在欧洲的俄罗斯资产所赚取的利息来筹集数十亿美元。但是，支付新武器费用的其他途径仍然遥遥无期。
item.description:
Using interest earned on frozen Russian assets held in Europe, the European Union plans to raise billions. But other ways to pay for new weapons remain elusive. https://t.co/seGd0kXfr0

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024
